RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Starter Allowance Purse 18600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE DECEMBER 7, 2021. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 7 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 7 All owed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DIVINE FASHION stalked inside then picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, took the nod leaving the far turn and dueled clear inside the sixteenth pole. BETCHA BY GOLLY took the lead approaching the three quarter pole, moved inward and rated the early pace off the rail, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn, was met entering the lane and relented mid-stretch while maintaining second. A LITTLE BIT CRAZY saved ground off the pace, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, angled out entering the stretch and finished evenly. SHERIFF'S KID raced in the four path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and ran evenly in the stretch. SECRET CASTLE raced off the rail the opening turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path then flattened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: A Little Bit Crazy
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,rail far turn,angled out 1/8,evenly lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 14200. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JUNE 7, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over Since June 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claimin g Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SWEET TALIA stalked off the rail then closed to the front two deep approaching the seven sixteenths pole, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn and held on well under steady handling. RUXTON ROCKS rounded the first turn about the four path, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced close in the three path on the far turn, but was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. CONGRESS HALL raced off the rail early, eased out with a bid leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and ran evenly to late stretch before flattening stride. CASTLE OF CAYLEE stalked the earlier pace from the three and four paths, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened stride. CICI UNIFIED stalked inside, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened past the five sixteenths. ONEPRETTYTHING rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure past the half mile pole, was caught approaching the seven sixteenths and weakened at the rail on the far turn. HOLLY'S PERSUASION settled back inside early, left the second turn outside and raced in the five and six paths on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Oneprettything
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,pressured 1/2,chased,weakened rail far turn

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Country Life Farm & Imagistic BroodmareII LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Congress Hall
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,eased out bid 3/8,rail far turn,flattened late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GABRIEL'S WING took a quick lead and rated the pace inside, was hand ridden away from the five sixteenths pole and drew off at the rail on the far turn, then kept alert through the stretch. SPEIGHTS YOUR MIND saved ground well off the pace, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the four path, dug in leaving the turn and got up for second later yards. SURF CITY GOLD raced in the four path the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and ran evenly in the lane. SPEAKERIT stalked two deep, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole and raced two deep on the far turn, then flattened in the lane. SCHMEAR settled off the rail the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced three wide on the far turn and weakened. I'LL FINISH became fractious in the gate then hopped at the break, stalked from the three and four paths the first turn, faded past the nine sixteenths pole, showed no response through the backstretch and was eased the final quarter mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Speights Your Mind
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,4p far turn,up 2nd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Gabriel's Wing
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,hand urged from 5/16,drew away turn,kept alert

ENTRY.NAME: Surf City Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Gardner Sean and MIH Affiliates LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SEEMS TO WHISPER gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn then closed quickly through the lane and got up the final yards. DEVIN ON EARTH set a pressured pace through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn, dug in under steady handling leaving the turn but was caught flattening stride the final yards. BAYLIS STREET broke awkwardly and bobbled outward leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and ran evenly in the lane. WATERLOO ROSE was forced out leaving the gate then gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. WATCH ME DISAPPEAR gave chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened. ZUPITA chased inside but roughed off the inside flank of Seems To Whisper leaving the five sixteenths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Seems to Whisper
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Cefalu John
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,3p turn,closed quickly lane,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Devin On Earth
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,caught flattening late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 61. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRINCESS HALO stalked inside then bid approaching the three eighths pole, took the lead two deep midway on the far turn and dug in determinedly to eke out the nod over the game stretch effort of IMINCHARGENOW, who took over at the three quarter pole and rated the pace inside, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole, was met at the rail midway on the far turn but dug in gamely to the wire. I SHALLBE RELEASED raced off the pace about the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, eased out leaving the turn and dueled through the stretch for third. JUST HAVE FAITH raced well off the early pace about the three path, bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced in the seven path on the far turn and passed some rivals outside. ABUNDANT STORY raced in tight quarters approaching the first turn then stalked off the rail through the turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened in the lane. KEY TO THE CASTLE raced in the five path the first turn, left the turn outside and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the six path and flattened in the lane. ODINA raced in tight quarters approaching the opening turn then stalked from the three path, gave chase passing the seven sixteenths pole but weakened into the far turn. DEREKA'S BLUFF raced in the five path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. LAURA'S GRAND rounded the opening turn about the four path and was through after a half mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Abundant Story
ENTRY.COMMENT: in tight nearing 1st turn,stalked,chased 7/16rail far turn,flatnd

ENTRY.NAME: Odina
ENTRY.COMMENT: in tight early,stalked 3p,chased 7/16,weakened into far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Iminchargenow
ENTRY.OWNER: Ali Andrew and Schottroffe Edward T
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,met mid turn,game try lane

ENTRY.NAME: Just Have Faith
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 3p,bid 3/8,7p far turn,passed rivals outside

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 38. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PLAYING FOR TWO tapered in and contested a pressured pace two deep through the backstretch, dueled clear approaching the head of the lane, was steadily handled in the upper stretch then taken in hand the final sixteenth. S S CASINO GIRL pressured the pace while in tight quarters at the rail, eased out leaving the turn and settled for second best. UNALTERED pressured the pace through the backstretch, raced close in the three path on the turn, flattened late stretch but held on for third. MSSNAP chased the pace then steadied approaching the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn near the rail, eased out leaving the turn and showed little in the lane. PALACIO chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and flattened in the lane. COLD CASH gave chase outside and raced wide on the turn. CREME DE LA QUEEN chased, entered the turn off the rail then drifted approaching the head of the lane. GATTOLOTTASPARKLE was not a factor. The Stewards reviewed then rejected a claim of foul against the rider of Playing For Two for alleged interference through the backstretch, lodged by the rider of S S Casino Girl.

ENTRY.NAME: S S Casino Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside,close rail turn,eased out 1/8,settled 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Unaltered
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed early pace,close 3p turn,flattened late,held on 3rd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING OR STARTER SINCE JUNE 6, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $20,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non- winners Of A Race Since November 7 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 7 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: YOUTHINKTHATSFUNNY saved ground close to the early pace, started a bid nearing the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn off the rail then eased out entering the stretch and dug in under steady handling to get up the final yards. REMYS SHOWTIME raced with the pace two deep then dug in leaving the three eighths pole, contested the far turn two deep and dueled through the stretch for second while outfinished for the win. HERO'S MAN raced with the pace inside, dug in leaving the three eighths pole, contested the rail on the far turn and remained a close factor to mid-stretch before flattening stride. JUNGLE BEAST settled in the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path then flattened in the lane. FEARNOUGHT saved early ground and showed little response through the backstretch. HUMPTY GRUMPTY stalked from the three path the first turn, entered the backstretch outside and gave chase toward the three eighths pole but flattened in the five path into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Youthinkthatsfunny
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid near 5/16,off rail turn,eased out,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Hero's Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: w/pace inside,dug in 3/8,rail far turn,caught flattening late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DAPHNE'S FIRE steadied leaving the gate then pressed the pace inside, contested even terms at the rail on the turn, dug in with the lead leaving the turn and held on well. MIDNIGHT PASS was hustled to the lead past the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, contested even terms two deep on the turn, dug in under steady stretch handling and just lasted for second. TOUGH ENOUGH gave chase through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn, dug in to take the nod for third under the wire and just missed second. GREAT DEVOTION gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. HONEYCAMP gave chase, rounded the turn in the four path and ran evenly in the lane. GOLDEN BLOSSOM chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and weakened in the lane. HERECOMES SCARLETT chased outside, raced in the six path on the turn and passed some rivals outside. HANNAHS RED RUBY was unprepared for the break, gave chase and raced in the four path on the turn. HOLY HIP chased, raced near the rail on the turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Daphne's Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied break,pressed inside,rail turn,dug in lane,held well

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Pass
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled up past 1/2,set pressured pace,2d turn,just lasted 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Holy Hip
ENTRY.OWNER: C M Racing Stables LLC and Lewis Jalen

ENTRY.NAME: Tough Enough
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,rail turn,dug in lane,nod 3rd wire,just missed 2nd
